title: Online Sabotaged Shortest Path

author: Dmitri Adamskiy, Royal Holloway, University of London

segmentation: So I'm Dimitry and together with Fountain Manfred we have this problem.

So basically we're trying to marry two techniques that we have to sort of techniques with we think are orthogonal's who we sort of know how to deal with combinatorial experts and that's exemplified by this online shortest path and we also know how to deal with sleeping experts and that is the sabotaged bid and now we're trying to see how that works together so.

Close to best path in hindsight and there are ways to do that so.
You might ask at this point why follow the leader is not good here in this network well.
London Underground has delays as integral part of it, so every day you have this announcement, we say minor delay on this line.
Major delays on those lines and then they list half of the lines and say this.
And the other thing which exists in London Underground is engineering works so because it's so old they have to constantly repair it, otherwise it will fall apart.
So every week they kind of shut down quarter of the system.
So the list is quite big and some edges on your graph become blocked.
So you can't use them.
So the question is.
So what counts as a solution now?
How do we compete with the path when certain edges of the path are not there?
So there are various approaches so.
One thing to do is to compete with a fixed strategy of choosing alternatives to blocked path.
So that was studied by people in this room and so some results are of kind of negative way.
So the hardness results.
So in fully adversarial setting this is hard already.
For simple graph like that simple graph like that, so some might recognize exercising in it, and if.
Sabotage is asked to kostick and losses are independent from them.
Then this is doable so, but we're interested in adversarial settings.
So what do we suggest?
So we kind of try to modify the notion of regret so to try to avoid this hardness problems.
So there is a national natural notion of regret which is the original specialist experts regrets.
Namely, we just compete with the path on the rounds when this path is awake.
So if Victoria Line is blocked today and they fix it so.
I'm not, I'm not competing with it today.
So why do we have any hope?
As well.
This notion of this policy regret is much is very rich comparison class.
So we think that this is less expressive and does gives us more hope.

That this notion of regrets there is an efficient algorithm for this particular graph, so at least it works in expert setting, and so obviously you can just treat all the paths as experts and get very inefficient algorithm which gets the kind of right regret.
So now the problem that we so we pose is whether there is an efficient algorithm for this natural type of.
Regret so.
If.
You if you think that you have a suggestion or to test your intuition, come and talk to us.
We think that we have an intriguing hard example too.
Just potential algorithms.
And Oh yeah, and bounces, so I think so if you solve this problem.
You will be able to participate in an annual night avocado harvest in Santa Cruz.
Well, yeah, there might be some sabotage is on the way, but yeah.
Thank you.
